oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Meat bone meal as nitrogen and phosphorus fertilizer
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chen, L.
Helenius, J.
Kangas, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Composting and manuring
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Meat bone meal (MBM) contains considerable amount of nutrients (~8 % N, ~ 5 % P and ~ 10 Ca). To quantify and qualify MBM use as an N and P fertilizers, two field experiments were done on spring barley and oat in 2000 and 2001.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Chen, L.; Helenius, J. and Kangas, A. (2009) Meat bone meal as nitrogen and phosphorus fertilizer. In: Programme abstracts list of participants, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 5 (2), NJF Report, p. 26.
